SEARCH
Package com.paymybuddy.ewallet.controller

Class BuddyController

java.lang.Object
com.paymybuddy.ewallet.controller.BuddyController
@RestController @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:4200") public class BuddyController extends Object
A class that receives requests made from some of the usual CRUD endpoints and specific URL for the Buddies. The @CrossOrigin annotation limits the acceptance of requests to those sent from the front-end.
Version:
1.0
Author:
SÃ©bastien Cappon
Singularity :
Some responses are filtered using JsonView to match the response pattern desired by the front-end.

  • Method Details

    • getBuddiesByUser

      @GetMapping("/mybuddies/{id}") @ResponseBody public List<User> getBuddiesByUser(@PathVariable("id") int userId)
      A GetMapping method on the /mybuddies URI with an user id as PathVariable. It calls the eponymous IBuddyService method and returns a list of User model entities.
      Returns:
      A User list.
      Front-end calling method(s) :
      contact.service.ts : getMyBuddies(userId: number)
      JsonView(s) :
      Display id, firstname, lastname, email and active attributes of the involved User model entities.

    • getActiveBuddiesByUser

      @GetMapping("/mybuddies/active/{id}") @ResponseBody public List<User> getActiveBuddiesByUser(@PathVariable("id") int userId)
      A GetMapping method on the /mybuddies/active URI with an user id as PathVariable. It calls the eponymous IBuddyService method and returns a list of User model entities.
      Returns:
      A User list.
      Front-end calling method(s) :
      transfer.service.ts : getMyActiveBuddies(userId: number)
      JsonView(s) :
      Display id, firstname, lastname, email and active attributes of the involved User model entities.

    • addBuddy

      @PostMapping("/buddy") @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> addBuddy(@RequestBody BuddyAddDto buddyAddDto)
      A PostMapping method on the /buddy URI with a DTO, consisting of the active user id and the future buddy user email, as RequestBody. It calls the eponymous IBuddyService method and returns the User added with status code 201. If the result is null, it returns status code 204.
      Returns:
      A User and a status code.
      Front-end calling method(s) :
      contact.service.ts : addBuddy(contactValue: ContactValue)
      JsonView(s) :
      Display id, firstname, lastname, email and active attributes of the involved User model entity.

    • deleteBuddy

      @DeleteMapping("/buddy/{firstUserId}-{secondUserId}") public void deleteBuddy(@PathVariable("firstUserId") int firstUserId, @PathVariable("secondUserId") int secondUserId)
      A DeleteMapping method on the /buddy URI with the two buddies user id as PathVariables. It calls the eponymous IBuddyService method and returns nothing.
      Front-end calling method(s) :
      contact.service.ts : unBuddy(userId: number, buddyId: number)
